backgroundInformationList.description: Notice of Application to Remove a Holding Symbol from Zoning By-Law - 743 Warden Avenue

noticeDescription:
NOTICE OF INTENTION TO REMOVE A HOLDING SYMBOL (H) FROM ZONING BY-LAW 528-2016 (OMB)

(Under the Planning Act)

 

The City has received the following application under Section 36 of the Planning Act:

 

Application Number: 23 184003 ESC 20 OZ

Location of Application: 743 Warden Avenue (Cleanside Road and Pidgeon Street)

Ward: Ward Ward 20 – Scarborough Southwest

Contact: Kelly Dynes, Planner, at 416-396-4250, by e-mail at Kelly.Dynes@toronto.ca, or by mailing to: Scarborough Civic Centre, 150 Borough Drive, 3rd Floor, Toronto, ON, M1P 4N7

 

DESCRIPTION

 

The application is to amend Zoning By-law 528-2016 (OMB) to remove a holding symbol (H) for Blocks 6-8 at 743 Warden Avenue and permit the blocks to be developed with townhouses. A further explanation of the effect of the removal of the holding symbol (H) is noted on the map below.

 

Detailed information regarding the above-listed proposal, including background information and materials may be made available for public inspection by contacting the Planner noted above or by visiting the City of Toronto’s Application Information Centre. 

 

 

 

MAKE YOUR VIEWS KNOWN

 

You may send written comments by mail or email to the Planner noted above. Your written comments must be submitted no later than February 23, 2024 to be considered by the Chief Planner and Executive Director, City Planning or designate. A decision by the Chief Planner and Executive Director, City Planning or designate as to whether to remove the holding symbol (H) will occur no earlier than March 12, 2024.

 

Notice to People Writing to the City: The City of Toronto Act, 2006, the Planning Act, and the City of Toronto Municipal Code authorize the City of Toronto to collect any personal information in your communication to the City.

 

The City collects this information to enable it to make informed decisions on the relevant issue(s).  If you are submitting letters, e-mails, or other communications to the City, you should be aware that your name and the fact that you communicated with the City will become part of the public record and will appear on the City's website. The City will also make your communication and any personal information in it - such as your postal address, telephone number or e-mail address - available to the public, unless you expressly request the City to remove it.
title: Notice of Application to Remove a Holding Symbol from Zoning By-Law - 743 Warden Avenue
topics: Planning > Intention to remove a Holding Symbol
